resources.string: This is the url when shared from the browser
This is the title of a web page when shared from the browser

Enter an url that the incoming text and subject should be forwarded to. If a regex is used, you can append a number to the name to get the matching group.\n\n For example having output name for text as @url, the pattern http://othersite.com/(.*) and an outgoing url as http://example.com/share?path=@url1, sharing the url http://othersite.com/123 with UrlForwarder would then result in a navigation to the url http://example.com/share?path=123
No filters added!\n\nPress the + button to add some!
Are you sure you want to delete \"%1$s\"?
